Instruction: Combine the lime juice, olive oil, garlic, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and red pepper flakes in a bowl and whisk until blended; then transfer the mixture into a large resealable plastic bag.
Place the chicken breasts in the bag, ensure they are covered with the marinade, remove excess air, and seal the bag.
Refrigerate to marinate for 8 hours or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Take the chicken out of the marinade and shake off any excess. Dispose of the leftover marinade. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish.

Bake the chicken breasts in the preheated oven until they are no longer pink in the middle and the juices run clear, approximately 35 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should indicate at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Shred the chicken breasts using two forks until you reach the desired consistency.
